title: Who invented the fretless bass? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fretless electric bass - as opposed to the upright (fretless) acoustic bass, you ask? The other 2 answers are not really on the mark, but 1 came close. Thought I’d have a look around, so I typed in “fretless bass” - & this is what came up: Bass guitar - Wikipedia Turns out the first person who is credited for pulling frets out of their bass was Bill Wyman in 1961; in 1966 Ampeg introduced the first production fretless bass.
I’m not sure whose idea it was, but Ampeg started making the fretless electric bass guitar in about 1960  Favored by lounge acts and Rick Danko. A heavy beast. They made this one in 1969
